channel.title: 2 new models
channel.description: Hey I'm pretty new at models, only been working on them for a few weeks :P but these are two of my models that I just made. Took me about 4 hours for both of them XD Please post constructive criticism and if your just going to flame GTFO, flaming doesn't really help anyone. But if it's constructive criticism then I can actually learn and make better models, if enough people like them I may release :D hope you like: Unnamed sword: [img]http://i53.tinypic.com/jsf0op.jpg[/img] Wire-frame: [img]http://i53.tinypic.com/15dwaz9.jpg[/img] Unnamed kite-shield: [img]http://i56.tinypic.com/28ko57o.jpg[/img] Wire-frame: [img]http://i54.tinypic.com/2yvt5hc.jpg[/img] Sorry if you think the wire-frames are horrendous but as I said earlier I am relatively new :P Made another model :D Scimitar: [IMG]http://i53.tinypic.com/2m2fg2t.jpg[/img] Wire-frame: [IMG]http://i53.tinypic.com/2h84pjl.jpg[/img]

item.title: 2 new models
item.dc:creator: @h1_sk1ller h1 sk1ller
item.description:
@h1_sk1ller wrote:

jakanddax222:

Thanks silentCJ for your complements and criticism, and you h1 skiller I will get to work right now on fixing a few of the faces ( which I think were created because I didn’t curve the emblem on the shield ), re-creating the sphere, and working on the spike to get it similar to the other ones.

No problem, you will be great! I just know it

Read full topic

item.title: 2 new models
item.dc:creator: @jakanddax222 jakanddax222
item.description:
@jakanddax222 wrote:

Thanks silentCJ for your complements and criticism, and you h1 skiller I will get to work right now on fixing a few of the faces ( which I think were created because I didn’t curve the emblem on the shield ), re-creating the sphere, and working on the spike to get it similar to the other ones.

item.title: 2 new models
item.dc:creator: @h1_sk1ller h1 sk1ller
item.description:
@h1_sk1ller wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:5, topic:377364”]They’re good models, quite attractive, though the shield has some messed up faces, particularly that middle left corner, and the top-middle-left corner, but those can be corrected at a later time if needed, but the design is good.

On the sword, along the set of spikes pointing upwards on the inside edge, why did you do that last spike different? Messed up the structure a little, it doesn’t matter hugely, but if you’re gonna do it a lot it’ll only cause problems for yourself. Finally, you segmented the sphere on the end of the handle way too much, not really necessary if you’re modelling for RSPS, and even if that is able to be added to a server, it’ll lag it a little.

But overall, great job for a novice.[/quote]

Agreed, just fix up the faces re-create the sphere and your good to go

Read full topic

item.title: 2 new models
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

They’re good models, quite attractive, though the shield has some messed up faces, particularly that middle left corner, and the top-middle-left corner, but those can be corrected at a later time if needed, but the design is good.

On the sword, along the set of spikes pointing upwards on the inside edge, why did you do that last spike different? Messed up the structure a little, it doesn’t matter hugely, but if you’re gonna do it a lot it’ll only cause problems for yourself. Finally, you segmented the sphere on the end of the handle way too much, not really necessary if you’re modelling for RSPS, and even if that is able to be added to a server, it’ll lag it a little.

But overall, great job for a novice.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @jakanddax222 jakanddax222
item.description:
@jakanddax222 wrote:

Thanks, I’ll work on making a more life-like sword next time, any ideas on how? I don’t really have any idea how to XD Thanks h1 skiller, for the positive comment

item.title: 2 new models
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

The shield looks great.

The sword/weapon looks pretty good, but can be improved upon. It might be just me, but it seems rather… Perfected, than unnatural.

Unless you’re looking for a sword that looks well-formatted, instead of forged.

Read full topic
